unnormalised: So, exams are over, right? And the big question looming over everyone's head is, what's the damage? LOL. Let’s talk about results, marks, percentages – the whole shebang. It's a stressful time, no doubt. My own little sister, Priya, just finished her 10th standard exams, and she's already biting her nails waiting for the CBSE results. They’re saying tentatively mid-May, but you know how these things go.
normalised: So, exams are over, right? And the big question looming over everyone's head is, what's the damage? L-O-L. Let’s talk about results, marks, percentages – the whole shebang. It's a stressful time, no doubt. My own little sister, Priya, just finished her tenth standard exams, and she's already biting her nails waiting for the C-B-S-E results. They’re saying tentatively mid-May, but you know how these things go.

unnormalised: Remember those nail-biting days waiting for your 12th results? I do! I was refreshing the website every 5 mins. Turns out I scored 85% overall. Papa was happy. Ma still wanted me to aim for 90%, classic. Good old days!
normalised: Remember those nail-biting days waiting for your twelfth results? I do! I was refreshing the website every five minutes. Turns out I scored eighty five percent overall. Papa was happy. Ma still wanted me to aim for ninety percent, classic. Good old days!

unnormalised: These days, everything is online. Back in my day, we had to actually go to the school notice board to check. Can you imagine the drama? Now, it's all about logging into the website and praying the server doesn’t crash. The CBSE website usually buckles under the pressure, tbh. Expect error messages and timeouts!
normalised: These days, everything is online. Back in my day, we had to actually go to the school notice board to check. Can you imagine the drama? Now, it's all about logging into the website and praying the server doesn’t crash. The C-B-S-E website usually buckles under the pressure, to be honest. Expect error messages and timeouts!

unnormalised: And what's with the GPA system anyway? I still don't fully understand it. Priya keeps explaining it to me. Something about a 9-point scale? I barely passed maths back in school. Let's stick to percentages, shall we? Though I heard they're bringing back marks alongside GPA scores for some subjects. So confusing.
normalised: And what's with the G-P-A system anyway? I still don't fully understand it. Priya keeps explaining it to me. Something about a nine-point scale? I barely passed maths back in school. Let's stick to percentages, shall we? Though I heard they're bringing back marks alongside G-P-A scores for some subjects. So confusing.

unnormalised: Then there's the whole "comparison game." Sharma ji's son got 98%! Verma ji's daughter topped the district! Aunties will be aunties. The pressure is immense! Honestly, just ignore them. It's YOUR result, and you should be proud of what you've achieved. Whether it’s 60%, 70%, or even just passing marks.
normalised: Then there's the whole "comparison game." Sharma ji's son got ninety eight percent! Verma ji's daughter topped the district! Aunties will be aunties. The pressure is immense! Honestly, just ignore them. It's YOUR result, and you should be proud of what you've achieved. Whether it’s sixty percent, seventy percent, or even just passing marks.

unnormalised: And let's not forget the dreaded entrance exams. JEE Main, NEET, CLAT… the list goes on and on. Those scores are a whole different ball game. Getting a rank under 10000 in JEE is considered pretty good, right? I think so. My friend's son aimed for 5000 but landed at 12000, he’s still pretty bummed about it.
normalised: And let's not forget the dreaded entrance exams. J-E-E Main, N-E-E-T, C-L-A-T… the list goes on and on. Those scores are a whole different ball game. Getting a rank under ten thousand in J-E-E is considered pretty good, right? I think so. My friend's son aimed for five thousand but landed at twelve thousand, he’s still pretty bummed about it.

unnormalised: Seriously, though, your marks don't define you. They are just a number, a snapshot in time. The real world is way more complicated (and interesting) than any exam paper. Focus on what you're passionate about, whether it's coding, writing, dancing, or just chilling with chai and friends.
normalised: Seriously, though, your marks don't define you. They are just a number, a snapshot in time. The real world is way more complicated (and interesting) than any exam paper. Focus on what you're passionate about, whether it's coding, writing, dancing, or just chilling with chai and friends.

unnormalised: So, deep breaths everyone! Results are coming, eventually. Try not to stress too much (easier said than done, I know!). And remember, even if you don't get the marks you were hoping for, there's always another way. Good luck, and don't forget to treat yourself to something nice, regardless of the outcome! Maybe a nice gulab jamun? You deserve it!
normalised: So, deep breaths everyone! Results are coming, eventually. Try not to stress too much (easier said than done, I know!). And remember, even if you don't get the marks you were hoping for, there's always another way. Good luck, and don't forget to treat yourself to something nice, regardless of the outcome! Maybe a nice gulab jamun? You deserve it!
